safety_component.definition: A component of a product or of an AI system which fulfils a safety function for that product or AI system, or the failure or malfunctioning of which endangers the health and safety of persons or property

alternative_formulations.description: Component that fulfils a safety function
Component whose failure or malfunctioning endangers health and safety

examples_implied: Braking system AI in autonomous vehicle

performance.definition: The ability of an AI system to achieve its intended purpose
performance.note: Functional definition - links to intended purpose

training_data.definition: Data used for training an AI system through fitting its learnable parameters

validation_data.definition: Data used for providing an evaluation of the trained AI system and for tuning its non-learnable parameters and its learning process in order, inter alia, to prevent underfitting or overfitting
validation_data.relationship_to_training: Separate from training data or may overlap per Art 3(31)

validation_data_set.definition: A separate data set or part of the training data set, either as a fixed or variable split
validation_data_set.flexibility: Can be separate or split from training data

testing_data.definition: Data used for providing an independent evaluation of the AI system in order to confirm the expected performance of that system before its placing on the market or putting into service

input_data.definition: Data provided to or directly acquired by an AI system on the basis of which the system produces an output
input_data.relationship: Distinct from training/validation/testing - this is runtime data

data_lifecycle_synthesis.note: Clear separation between development and operational data
